API ReferenceÔÉÅ

This section provides a detailed reference of all modules, classes, and functions in the PyQt Live Tuner library.

Core ComponentsÔÉÅ

ApplicationBuilderÔÉÅ

class pyqt_live_tuner.ApplicationBuilder(title='My Application')ÔÉÅ

A builder class that provides a clean interface for creating and running PyQt Live Tuner applications.

Parameters:

title (str) ‚Äì The title for the application window (default: ‚ÄúMy Application‚Äù)

main_windowÔÉÅ

The main application window instance (pyqt_live_tuner.MainApplication).

run()ÔÉÅ

Build the main window and launch the application. This method blocks until the application is closed.

Returns:

None

MainApplicationÔÉÅ

class pyqt_live_tuner.MainApplication(title='My Application')ÔÉÅ

The main window class for PyQt Live Tuner applications. It manages parameter containers and provides menu options for saving and loading configurations.

Parameters:

title (str) ‚Äì The title for the window (default: ‚ÄúMy Application‚Äù)

set_parameters_container(container, name='Parameters')ÔÉÅ

Sets the parameters container for the application.

Parameters:

  • container (ParametersContainer) ‚Äì The container to set

  • name (str) ‚Äì The label to display above the container

Returns:

None

set_configurations_container(container, name='Configurations')ÔÉÅ

Sets the configurations container for the application.

Parameters:

  • container (ConfigurationsContainer) ‚Äì The container to set

  • name (str) ‚Äì The label to display above the container

Returns:

None

add_parameter(param)ÔÉÅ

Adds a parameter widget to the parameters container, creating the container if it doesn‚Äôt exist.

Parameters:

param (ParameterWidget) ‚Äì The parameter widget to add

Returns:

None

add_parameter_group(group)ÔÉÅ

Adds a parameter group to the parameters container, creating the container if it doesn‚Äôt exist.

Parameters:

group (ParameterGroupWidget) ‚Äì The parameter group to add

Returns:

None

add_configuration_widget(widget, label=None)ÔÉÅ

Adds a widget to the configurations container, creating the container if it doesn‚Äôt exist.

Parameters:

  • widget (QWidget) ‚Äì The widget to add

  • label (str) ‚Äì Optional label to display above the widget

Returns:

None

Container ComponentsÔÉÅ

ParametersContainerÔÉÅ

class pyqt_live_tuner.containers.ParametersContainer(parent=None)ÔÉÅ

A scrollable container for organizing parameter widgets and groups. Supports reading and applying values from JSON.

Parameters:

parent (QWidget) ‚Äì The parent widget

add_param(widget)ÔÉÅ

Adds a parameter widget to the container.

Parameters:

widget (ParameterWidget) ‚Äì The parameter widget to add

Returns:

None

add_group(group)ÔÉÅ

Adds a parameter group to the container.

Parameters:

group (ParameterGroupWidget) ‚Äì The parameter group to add

Returns:

None

get_values()ÔÉÅ

Returns the current values of all parameters and groups.

Returns:

A dictionary of parameter values

Return type:

dict

set_values(values)ÔÉÅ

Sets the values of parameters and groups based on the provided dictionary.

Parameters:

values (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary of parameter values

Returns:

None

ConfigurationsContainerÔÉÅ

class pyqt_live_tuner.containers.ConfigurationsContainer(parent=None)ÔÉÅ

A container for configuration widgets such as plots, image displays, or other custom widgets.

Parameters:

parent (QWidget) ‚Äì The parent widget

Parameter WidgetsÔÉÅ

ParameterWidget (Base Class)ÔÉÅ

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_widgets.ParameterWidget(name='Unnamed', config=None)ÔÉÅ

The base class for all parameter widgets. Implements common functionality and defines the interface that all parameter widgets must follow.

Parameters:

  • name (str) ‚Äì The name of the parameter

  • config (dict) ‚Äì A configuration dictionary for the widget

valueChangedÔÉÅ

A PyQt signal that is emitted when the parameter value changes.

Signal signature: valueChanged(name: str, value: Any)

get_value()ÔÉÅ

Returns the current value of the parameter. Must be implemented by subclasses.

Returns:

The current parameter value

Return type:

Any

set_value(value)ÔÉÅ

Sets the value of the parameter. Must be implemented by subclasses.

Parameters:

value (Any) ‚Äì The new parameter value

Returns:

None

register_callback(callback)ÔÉÅ

Registers a function to be called when the parameter value changes.

Parameters:

callback (callable) ‚Äì A function that takes (name, value) arguments

Returns:

None

FloatParameterWidgetÔÉÅ

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_widgets.FloatParameterWidget(name='Unnamed', config=None)ÔÉÅ

A parameter widget for adjusting floating-point values using a slider or spin box.

Parameters:

  • name (str) ‚Äì The name of the parameter

  • config (dict) ‚Äì

    Configuration dictionary with the following optional keys:

    • min (float): Minimum value (default: 0.0)

    • max (float): Maximum value (default: 10.0)

    • step (float): Step size (default: 0.1)

    • initial (float): Initial value (default: min)

    • precision (int): Decimal precision (default: 2)

set_value(value)ÔÉÅ

Sets the current value of the parameter.

Parameters:

value (float) ‚Äì The new parameter value

Returns:

None

get_value()ÔÉÅ

Returns the current value of the parameter.

Returns:

The current parameter value

Return type:

float

BoolParameterWidgetÔÉÅ

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_widgets.BoolParameterWidget(name='Unnamed', config=None)ÔÉÅ

A parameter widget for boolean values using a checkbox.

Parameters:

  • name (str) ‚Äì The name of the parameter

  • config (dict) ‚Äì

    Configuration dictionary with the following optional keys:

    • initial (bool): Initial state (default: False)

set_value(value)ÔÉÅ

Sets the current state of the checkbox.

Parameters:

value (bool) ‚Äì The new parameter state

Returns:

None

get_value()ÔÉÅ

Returns the current state of the checkbox.

Returns:

The current checkbox state

Return type:

bool

DropdownParameterWidgetÔÉÅ

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_widgets.DropdownParameterWidget(name='Unnamed', config=None)ÔÉÅ

A parameter widget for selecting from a list using a dropdown.

Parameters:

  • name (str) ‚Äì The name of the parameter

  • config (dict) ‚Äì

    Configuration dictionary with the following optional keys:

    • options (list): List of options (default: [])

    • initial (str): Initial selection (default: first option)

    • placeholder (str): Placeholder text (default: ‚ÄúSelect an option‚Äù)

set_value(value)ÔÉÅ

Sets the current selection.

Parameters:

value (str) ‚Äì The new selection

Returns:

None

get_value()ÔÉÅ

Returns the current selection.

Returns:

The current selection

Return type:

str

update_options(options, initial=None)ÔÉÅ

Updates the available options in the dropdown.

Parameters:

  • options (list) ‚Äì The new list of options

  • initial (str) ‚Äì The new initial selection (optional)

Returns:

None

StringParameterWidgetÔÉÅ

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_widgets.StringParameterWidget(name='Unnamed', config=None)ÔÉÅ

A parameter widget for entering text using a line edit.

Parameters:

  • name (str) ‚Äì The name of the parameter

  • config (dict) ‚Äì

    Configuration dictionary with the following optional keys:

    • initial (str): Initial text (default: ‚Äú‚Äù)

    • placeholder (str): Placeholder text (default: ‚Äú‚Äù)

set_value(value)ÔÉÅ

Sets the current text.

Parameters:

value (str) ‚Äì The new text

Returns:

None

get_value()ÔÉÅ

Returns the current text.

Returns:

The current text

Return type:

str

ActionParameterWidgetÔÉÅ

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_widgets.ActionParameterWidget(name='Unnamed', config=None)ÔÉÅ

A parameter widget for triggering actions using a button.

Parameters:

  • name (str) ‚Äì The name of the parameter (button text)

  • config (dict) ‚Äì

    Configuration dictionary with the following optional keys:

    • callback (callable): Function to call when button is clicked

set_value(value)ÔÉÅ

This method is a no-op for action widgets since they don‚Äôt have a persistent value.

Parameters:

value (Any) ‚Äì Ignored

Returns:

None

get_value()ÔÉÅ

Returns None since action widgets don‚Äôt have a persistent value.

Returns:

None

Parameter GroupsÔÉÅ

ParameterGroupWidget (Base Class)ÔÉÅ

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_groups.ParameterGroupWidget(title='Unnamed Group', parent=None)ÔÉÅ

The base class for all parameter groups. Implements common functionality for organizing and managing related parameters.

Parameters:

  • title (str) ‚Äì The title of the group

  • parent (QWidget) ‚Äì The parent widget

title()ÔÉÅ

Returns the title of the group.

Returns:

The group title

Return type:

str

add_parameter(widget)ÔÉÅ

Adds a parameter widget to the group.

Parameters:

widget (ParameterWidget) ‚Äì The parameter widget to add

Returns:

None

get_values()ÔÉÅ

Returns the current values of all parameters in the group.

Returns:

A dictionary of parameter values

Return type:

dict

set_values(values)ÔÉÅ

Sets the values of parameters in the group based on the provided dictionary.

Parameters:

values (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary of parameter values

Returns:

None

LinkedParameterGroupÔÉÅ

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_groups.LinkedParameterGroup(title='Unnamed Group', parent=None)ÔÉÅ

A group of related parameters that emits a signal with all parameter values when any parameter changes.

Parameters:

  • title (str) ‚Äì The title of the group

  • parent (QWidget) ‚Äì The parent widget

groupChangedÔÉÅ

A PyQt signal that is emitted when any parameter in the group changes.

Signal signature: groupChanged(group_name: str, values: dict)

add_parameter(widget)ÔÉÅ

Adds a parameter widget to the group and connects its valueChanged signal.

Parameters:

widget (ParameterWidget) ‚Äì The parameter widget to add

Returns:

None

register_callback(callback)ÔÉÅ

Registers a function to be called when any parameter in the group changes.

Parameters:

callback (callable) ‚Äì A function that takes (group_name, values_dict) arguments

Returns:

None

IndependentGroupWidgetÔÉÅ

class pyqt_live_tuner.parameter_groups.IndependentGroupWidget(title='Unnamed Group', parent=None)ÔÉÅ

A group of parameters that are visually grouped but don‚Äôt emit a combined signal. Each parameter emits its own independent signals.

Parameters:

  • title (str) ‚Äì The title of the group

  • parent (QWidget) ‚Äì The parent widget

add_parameter(widget)ÔÉÅ

Adds a parameter widget to the group without connecting signals.

Parameters:

widget (ParameterWidget) ‚Äì The parameter widget to add

Returns:

None

Utility ClassesÔÉÅ

LoggerÔÉÅ

pyqt_live_tuner.loggerÔÉÅ

A logging utility for debugging and tracing. Uses Python‚Äôs built-in logging module.
